data.title: Best place to go after a big SEC win
data.text: It's the best breakfast fast food you will find, and it is a staple, after a big SEC win, I never like grits till I had them at the waffle house, it's a southern tradition.

data.title: A Southern Tradition in the Perfect Location
data.text: When Anthony Bourdain likes a place you know it's good and unpretentious. Waffle Houses are everywhere along the I-85 corridor in the south, but the Glenn Avenue location is relatively new and situated a few blocks from the Auburn campus. Get the hash browns with exactly what you want on them. And learn why the egg and bacon sandwich on Texas Toast comes with mayonnaise and pickles. Load them on! And keep an eye out for local luminaries, such Auburn coach Gus Malzahn who stops in for a bite after games.

data.title: when you need to eat while late night cramming
data.text: the food is average, but the fact this place is always open fits in the college schedule perfectly. We have met her for all kind of reasons, cramming for exams, late night and nothing else is open, late night game day

data.title: Give a waffle a chance
data.text: If you never visited one of these chains then it's time you did. We simply had waffles and Coffee and they were lovely. Reasonable price, great staff.

data.title: Just cant resist a Pecan Waffle!
data.text: Waffle House is a staple.  I love their coffee, love the pecan waffle with a side order of bacon.  Always friendly fast service and they don't mind if you hang out at your table and chat for a while, drink coffee

data.title: Quick lunch
data.text: Stopped here for a quick lunch. Staff was very friendly. The food was served hot and fast which was great as we only had a short time for lunch.

data.title: the worst, dirty, s**ty food ever
data.text: we made a big mistake to come here 11/23/2015.  The place is so small, dirty, horrible horrible foods, our waiter look dirty and smell from cigarette smoke.  this place is filthy dirty and nasty.  This waffle House serving garbage foods.  Please just dont go here.  There is a International pan cake house near by and the foods like 100x better.

data.title: Avoid Sunday Mornings
data.text: Very limited parking.  Between 8am and 11:00am expect to wait 40 to 45 minutes from when you walk in until your are eating.  In our last visit one of the group had finished eating before the last two people in the group got their food.

data.title: Best Breakfast
data.text: An institution!    Pecan waffle and a side of  bacon !   Great breakfast, fast , friendly, always good, always affordable

data.title: Sunday morning staple
data.text: We love Waffle House on Sunday morning.  Friendly staff.  Fast service.  Everything is delicious.  I love the All American Breakfast.  Lots of food and great value!  My husband loves their steak and eggs.  He orders it with tomatoes and loves it.

data.title: Good food at an odd time of day
data.text: We arrived late to Auburn & there were very few placed to get dinner.  We chose Waffle House as it was a block from our hotel.  Derek was our server.  He is a student at Auburn University and a very nice guy with a good sense of humor.  He wasn't sure about a west coast couple & my cousin from Auburn but he survived.  Derek was interactive, polite and a darn good server.

data.title: Where the coaches go
data.text: My husband told me that this is the location that the Auburn University Coach insists on going after game-day.  He has great taste- great service and good taste.

data.title: Best WH unit ever
data.text: We recently spent three days in Auburn AL looking at the University. While there, we ate breakfast at the Glenn Street Waffle House each day. I have been eating at Waffle House for three decades and this unit was cleanest, best staffed and produced the best WH food in a very short time. I wish my local Mobile unit was as good.

data.title: Could've been better!
data.text: We stopped at this Waffle House on the way home from visiting family.  There were 7 people in our party.  No one acknowledged us as we walked in and we had to clean our own spots to sit.  The place wasn't especially busy, but the staff were a hot mess.  Our orders came out wrong.  We ate because we were hungry and it wasn't worth sending the food back.  The bright spots were the juke box and the Auburn decor.  I'm an Alabama fan, so you know it's bad if I consider the Auburn decor a "bright spot."  I hope the place was just having a bad day or gets some new team members.  It could be a great place!

data.title: A Waffle House, is a good house!
data.text:
My bucket list of food heaven includes Waffle Houses. I've had the chance to pick Waffle House booths in four states, and each one has been consistent with hot, tasty, diner style food, friendly faces, and a happy stomach. It's never easy to road trip through the south without Waffle House signs tempting your taste buds. My daughter, and I had to indulge in Waffle House before starting another leg of our trip. Our stop in Tiger Country was long enough for a good breakfast, we were greeted with hellos as we walked in, and settled into our corner booth. There is something about being called darling, or honey that just makes me feel warm, and loved. (Even if it's from a woman I've never met before). My daughter ordered her scrambled eggs, sausage patties, and hash browns with sweet tea. Knowing you stop at Waffle House with scattered, covered, smothered on the brain, I ordered sunny side eggs, bacon, and hash browns. Everything was just the way breakfast should always be, hot, fresh, and satisfying. 
Our server was friendly, and quick to replace a broken sugar shaker. Waffle House is the place where if you're a regular, everyone does know your name. If you're passing through you're still made to feel as if you're not a stranger. This is the kind of house you dream of, or at least wish every other place was like. Great all around!

data.title: Bad experience at Opelika, Al. Store
data.text: My plastic oj glass had a huge chip missing from top rim. Waffle was served undercooked. Soft textured and not the least bit tan or brown. THE WORST ISSUE:  The store was busy and an african american couple took a waiting seat next to us at the front window. Our waitress whispered to a white couple seated next to us and who had finished their meal...to "keep seated for awhile so I don't have to serve them". The couple waiting were the only one's waiting for a table. I could hardly believe what I overheard but my wife confirmed, it was exactly what she had said. The couple got tired of watching the seated couple just sitting for 10 minutes so they left.

data.title: Waffle House Opelika Outstanding
data.text: Enjoyed a great breakfast at the Waffle House in Opelika. We came in around noon on Sunday, they were cleaning the store after the rush and the servers were still in great spirits, welcoming everyone as they came in with a hearty good morning, welcome to waffle house. The food was cooked to order and consistent with what we expect from a waffle house. The coffee was hot and rich tasting. The hash browns cooked to order and just seasoned right, my eggs were perfect and the waffle a nice accompaniment. We enjoyed our breakfast.

data.title: Nasty
data.text:
From the kitchen in back to the tables, floors, napkins , windows and counters this is the worst place I've ever eaten! Can't call the food tasteless because the taste was bad! 
The coffee wasn't worth drinking so after a taste and one bite of my waffle I paid and said goodbye forever!

data.title: Bom e barato
data.text: Cardápio variado e preços atrativos. Sua maior vantagem é o horário de funcionamento está sempre aberto. O atendimento é rápido e geralmente não está lotado. Há uma pequena área para estacionamento  e o acesso de cadeirantes è simples.
